climbs.name: Where's Poppy?
climbs.fa: Jim Barnes, Kristin Barnes, Marc Lovell 8/2016

content.description: Excellent and varied climbing up twin cracks. Devious moves get you to the bulge. Move right under the bulge to the shared anchor with Chocolate Santa and Stink Foot. Lower off.

This climbs the face just above the right edge of the pyramid. Gain the face from right side of ledge. It can be accessed from the three bolt start of The Pharaoh or as an alternate finish to Hanz and Franz. Shared anchors with Bromancing the Stone. Lower off.

climbs.name: Thin Mint
climbs.fa: Marc Lovell, Joy Engblade, Jim Barnes 8/2016

content.description: Climb the thin flake, then make some interesting moves up and left thru the roof. Lower off.
This route splits the face between Where’s Poppy and Chocolate Santa and shares the same anchor. Techy and sustained. 25m. Lower off.
content.location: Stink Foot is located on the right side of Pyramid Wall.

content.description: This toprope starts ~20 down and right of Peppermint Patty. Hard slab climbing on a blunt arete leads to the obvious right facing flake. Continue to the Peppermint Patty anchors. Lower off.
content.protection: This is a toprope option from the Peppermint Patty anchors.

content.description: Start as for Hieroglyphics. Climb face past 3 bolts to the ledge. Step right into beautiful left facing corner that forms the right side of the pyramid. Jam, lieback and stem your way up the corner. Clip the bolt and move past the Swallow’s Roof at the apex of the pyramid. Continue up crack...an engaging pitch! Lower off.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Gear to #3 Camalot. Doubles .5-#2 Camalot. Slings. Optional #4 Camalot. 32m.

content.description: Climb the thin flake, then move right under roof and continue up right facing corner. Originally led on gear. Bolts later added to the protect the flake. Lower off.

Starts 5m right of Hanz and Franz. Easy climbing heads up and right past the large chock stone. Continue up the crack that curves up and left and joins The Herman Connection below the last two bolts. Finish on The Herman Connection. Climb this only if you have climbed everything else on the cliff and have nothing better to do.  Lower off.

climbs.name: Land 'o Lakes
climbs.fa: Joy Engblade, Marc Lovell, Jim Barnes 7/2016

content.description: Start in the right facing corner. Make a challenging mantle at the horizontal crack, then get physical as you move up and left over roof. Easier climbing to the top. Lower off.

climbs.name: Hieroglyphics
climbs.fa: Jim Barnes, Kristin Barnes, Marc Lovell 8/2016

content.description: Climb face past 3 bolts to ledge. From the ledge, the game begins as you launch towards the right facing corner that forms the left side of the pyramid. Cool moves go up and left thru roof. Continue up crack and thin face. Techy and sustained. This route shares the anchor with The Pharaoh. 32 m. Lower off.
content.protection: 14 quick draws. Some slings on the second and third bolts and below the roof will help with rope drag.

content.description: Start as for Hanz and Franz. Jam and lieback up right facing corner. Make the connection to the higher right facing corner and continue past five bolts. Engaging climbing and variety of techniques will see you thru the challenges...Saves the best for last. Fun movement over stone! 30 m. Lower off.

Jam, lieback and stem up right facing corner.  At the break in the corner, commit to the moves up and left around the bulge towards The Pharaoh and into a wider crack that splits the headwall. Lower off.

This is the aesthetically pleasing top rope that begins just left of Land 'o Lakes and goes up the knobby face to the anchors of Land ‘o Lakes. You can make this as easy or as hard as you want. Good for some extra mileage.
content.protection: A good cord hanging from the bomber anchors above

content.description: Start up and left from Heiroglyphics and The Pharaoh from the left side of the pyramid. Bouldery crux. 30m. Lower off.
content.location: Funky Tut is on the center left part of the wall and starts in the left side of the pyramid.

climbs.name: Christmas in July
climbs.fa: Marc Lovell, Joy Engblade, Jim Barnes 7/2016

content.description: Tip toe past some tricky moves on the shared start with Chocolate Santa, then move up and right on the hand rail and into the widening crack. Lower off.

Climb face (Shared start with Christmas in July), then move left and up diagonal crack. The upper section was first led GU on gear. Bolts were added later. Lower off. Shared anchors with Where's Poppy and Stink Foot.

Start as for The Pharaoh. Climb face past 3 bolts to the ledge. Step right into beautiful left facing corner that forms the right side of the pyramid. Just below the Swallow’s Roof, bust right and up crack and knobs to anchor. Lower off.
